effects: You summon a primal beast companion (Beast of the Land, Sea, or Sky); it is friendly and obeys your commands.
The beast bears primal markings indicating its supernatural origin and vanishes if you die.
In combat, the beast acts on your turn; it can move and use its reaction on its own, but it takes only the Dodge action unless you command it.
You can use a bonus action to command it to take an action in its stat block or another action.
You can forgo one attack when you take the Attack action to command the beast to take the Beast's Strike action.
If you have the Incapacitated condition, the beast acts on its own and isn't limited to the Dodge action.
If the beast died within the last hour, you can take a Magic action to touch it and expend a spell slot; it returns to life after 1 minute with all hit points restored.
If you summon a new beast, the old one vanishes.
limits: When you finish a long rest, you can summon a different primal beast, which appears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of you.

feature_defs.trigger: when you command your primal companion with a bonus action
effects: It can also take the Dash, Disengage, Dodge, or Help action using its bonus action.
When it hits with an attack roll and deals damage, it can deal Force damage or its normal damage type (your choice).

feature_defs.trigger: when you command the beast to take the Beast's Strike action
effects: The beast can use Beast's Strike twice.
The first time each turn it hits a creature under your Hunter's Mark, it deals extra Force damage equal to the bonus damage of that spell.

feature_defs.trigger: when you cast a spell targeting yourself
effects: You can also affect your primal companion with the spell if it is within 30 feet of you.
